Short: IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History for Measles
Definition: Data elements for the IMMZ.D1 Capture Client History Data Dictionary for Measles.
The patient who is being checked for contraindications.
Indicates if the client has received a birth dose and/or supplementary dose

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.

Short: Date when primary vaccination series was completed
Definition: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The infant was preterm, the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised or immunosuppressed
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)

Condition(s): ele-1:All FHIR elements must have a @value or children {hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count())}

Definition: Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library list of codes applies in this data element
Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when the vaccine was administered to the client
